result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerardo Diaz Palma

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Adjournment, filed by ADA Sitzberger.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/26/2022 - The adjournment is granted. The sentencing hearing will be set in early January.*
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

1:53 PM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Gerardo Diaz Palma.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case was set for jury status with co-defendant in 22CF254, but parties have reached a resolution. 
State places offer on the record and requests separate sentencing hearing.
Court reads offer into the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 5 & 6.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Counts 1-4 are Dismissed and read in. 
The trial is removed from the calendar.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 7/29/22.

Jury status hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

04:10 PM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has complied with victim's rights.
Case called for scheduling conference.
ADA Sitzberger updates the court on discovery and offer extended by the State.
Court schedules cases 22CF254 and 22CF253 for trial, as the cases have been joined.
Court will issue a trial scheduling order. Parties are advised to pay attention to deadlines.

  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on July 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on July 27, 2022 at 04:00 pm.  **Scheduling error; reset for 7/28.**
Hearing on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.  **Rescheduled due to Jury Trial.**

08:59 AM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has complied with victim's rights. 
Atty Martinez has made inquiries to find one piece of discovery that couldn't be viewed.
State is working on it and will make an offer prior.  
Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
WCS GPS update.
Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:48 AM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Alyssa Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is working on accumulating all of discovery. Defense has not received an offer.
Defense requests time to review voluminous discovery.  
  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gerardo Diaz Palma
Current: 222 Douglass Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 03-14-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

**AND COURT ORDERS CASH BOND AMENDED DOWN TO $25,000 TO BE POSTED ONLY BY DEFENDANT'S FATHER, JOSE DIAZ.**
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS: 
Defendant is prohibited from applying for a passport. 
Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.
Mr. Diaz agrees to report any non-compliance to the court. 
Defendant must reside with his parents 222 Douglas, Waukesha, WI 53186. 
Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Jeremy Rodriguez, Or any of the individuals listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victims A-E/witness A-D/individuals in the vehicle at the time of the alleged offense/Jeremy Rodriguez/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.   Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

11:30 AM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
Case called to address Motion to Modify Bond with Co-defendant.
Attorneys for Defendants make arguments to modify the bond on the record. 
Victims object to modification of bail per ADA Sitzberger.
State believes $100,000 cash bond is appropriate for reasons as stated on the record. 
For reasons as stated on the record, the Court modifies the Cash bond down to $25,000 and orders it signed by Defendant's father, with additional conditions placed on the record.
Bail/bond hearing on March 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

08:39 AM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
All parties are in agreement for this matter to be held before Branch 10. 
Atty Martinez does request this matter be held with the co defendant and this motion be held over until that date and time. 
No objections. 
Court sets matter over.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Nicholas Martinez.
Hearing on March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:20 AM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel previously waived reading of information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Date remains as previously set for March 9, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Hearing on March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on February 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

08:40 AM Defendant Gerardo Diaz Palma in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha, Detective, Jay Carpenter sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Sitzberger.  Cross examination by Atty. Martinez.  Atty. Sitzberger moves for bind over.  Atty. Martinez moves to dismiss.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Discovery received.    Waive reading of Information.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
